org.apache.ignite.hadoop.fs

Class BasicHadoopFileSystemFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ignite.hadoop.fs.BasicHadoopFileSystemFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Externalizable, Serializable, HadoopFileSystemFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CachingHadoopFileSystemFactory, KerberosHadoopFileSystemFactory

    public class BasicHadoopFileSystemFactory
extends Object
implements HadoopFileSystemFactory, Externalizable
    Simple Hadoop file system factory which delegates to FileSystem.get() on each call.

    If "fs.[prefix].impl.disable.cache" is set to true, file system instances will be cached by Hadoop.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getUri

        @Nullable
public @Nullable String getUri()
        Gets file system URI.

        This URI will be used as a first argument when calling FileSystem.get(URI, Configuration, String).

        If not set, default URI will be picked from file system configuration using FileSystem.getDefaultUri(Configuration) method.

        Returns:
        File system URI.

      • setUri

        public void setUri(@Nullable
                   @Nullable String uri)
        Sets file system URI. See getUri() for more information.
        Parameters:
        uri - File system URI.

      • getConfigPaths

        @Nullable
public @Nullable String[] getConfigPaths()
        Gets paths to additional file system configuration files (e.g. core-site.xml).

        Path could be either absolute or relative to IGNITE_HOME environment variable.

        All provided paths will be loaded in the order they provided and then applied to Configuration. It means that path order might be important in some cases.

        Returns:
        Paths to file system configuration files.

      • setConfigPaths

        public void setConfigPaths(@Nullable
                           String... cfgPaths)
        Set paths to additional file system configuration files (e.g. core-site.xml). See getConfigPaths() for more information.
        Parameters:
        cfgPaths - Paths to file system configuration files.

      • getUserNameMapper

        @Nullable
public @Nullable UserNameMapper getUserNameMapper()
        Get optional user name mapper.

        When IGFS is invoked from Hadoop, user name is passed along the way to ensure that request will be performed with proper user context. User name is passed in a simple form and doesn't contain any extended information, such as host, domain or Kerberos realm. You may use name mapper to translate plain user name to full user name required by security engine of the underlying file system.

        For example you may want to use KerberosUserNameMapper to user name from "johndoe" to "johndoe@YOUR.REALM.COM".

        Returns:
        User name mapper.

      • setUserNameMapper

        public void setUserNameMapper(@Nullable
                              @Nullable UserNameMapper usrNameMapper)
        Set optional user name mapper. See getUserNameMapper() for more information.
        Parameters:
        usrNameMapper - User name mapper.
